name: Maggie Magnet (Deuce (+-Joy))
description:
A simple platformer about a magnet trying to save her sister from a magician's pocket-sized world; incomplete with only a few levels available, however the level editor should be sufficient to generate and play rudimentary levels. Please enjoy playing around with Maggie's unique skills!

Use your magnetic abilities to push and pull your way through a variety of levels! If you're running out of steam, pick up some sparks and recharge your health!

Play Controls

Move Gamepad
Left Stick / D-Pad
Keyboard
Arrow Keys / WASD Run left and right. Self-explanatory, really. Jump Gamepad
A
Keyboard
Z / Space Jump up in the air. Hold it to jump higher. If you're magnetised to a wall, you can jump off of it too! Polarity Gamepad
X
Keyboard
X Switches between the very scientific red and blue polarities. Red is attracted to blue, and repelled by red. Blue is attracted to red, and repelled by blue. Rotate Gamepad
L / R / LT / RT
Keyboard
Q / Left Shift / C / E Rotates Maggie's body clockwise and counter-clockwise. You can only be magnetised to an object if you're facing it! Pause Gamepad
Start
Keyboard
Escape Stops you from playing.

Build Controls

Move Cursor Gamepad
Left Stick / D-Pad
Keyboard
Mouse Moves the build cursor around. If you move it close to the edge of the screen, the camera will follow after it. Scroll Camera Gamepad
Right Stick
Keyboard
Arrow Keys / WASD Moves the camera on its own without moving the build cursor. Can be useful to quickly get to a part of the level. Build Gamepad
A
Keyboard
Left Click Places your selected block/object right on top of the cursor. Keep holding to place more! Delete Gamepad
B
Keyboard
Right Click Deletes whatever the cursor is pointed at. Also closes the Modify Menu. Modify Gamepad
X
Keyboard
Left Shift / Middle Click Implements simple tweaks (e.g. spike direction) on the object the cursor's pointing at. For more complicated objects (e.g. blocks, gates, magnets) it opens the Modify Menu, allowing you to tweak various elements. Switch Selection Gamepad
LT / RT
Keyboard
Just, like, click on them Changes the object you have selected for placement. You can also choose menu options like playtesting or getting back to the title. If they don't work at first, try "placing" them.

Credits & Junk

The main theme was composed by Sam Shandley! I highly recommend checking out his work.

Otherwise the game was made by me I guess?

Personally I recommend using a gamepad for playing and keyboard for building.

And be sure to only play levels from people you trust! I don't think a raw text dump could do anything too harmful, mind you, but it's always better to be careful.
